it.polimi.se2018.controller

Class ScorerTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2018.controller.ScorerTest

  • public class ScorerTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Test for Scorer Class The tests are run with RowsColumnsPublicObjectiveCardTest, DiagonalsPublicObjectiveCardTest, SetPublicObjectiveCardTest and PrivateObjectiveCardTest since the scorer uses these cards and the scores strongly depend on the scoring processo of the PublicObjectiveCard.
    Author:
    Jacopo Pio Gargano

      static void buildWindowPatterns()
      Creates a new Window Pattern Manager and creates the specific patterns of the players for the test

      Getting the singleton instance of scorer
      static void initializePlayersAndCards()
      Giving private objective cards to players and setting the public objective cards for the tests

      Tests the winner of a game with four players, all with different scores Rankings are manually created Rankings should be ordered by descending score

      Tests the winner of a game with four players, all with different scores Rankings are computed by the scorer Rankings should be ordered by descending score

      Tests the throwing of an EmptyListException if rankings parameter is empty

      Teststhe impossibility of getting the winner of a game if the parameter rankings is null

      Tests the calculation of the winner score Rankings are computed by the scorer Rankings should be ordered by descending score
      void testInactivePlayers() 
      void testSameFavorTokensRankings()
      Tests the rankings of a game with four players All players have the same score All players have the same PrivateObjectiveCard score All players have the same number of tokens The rankings should be the same as the ordered list of players of last round (reverse turn order)
      void testSamePrivateObjectiveCardScoreRankings()
      Tests the rankings of a game with four players All players have the same score All players have the same PrivateObjectiveCard score All players have a different number of tokens Rankings should be ordered by descending number of tokens

      Tests the rankings of a game with four players All players have the same score All players have different PrivateObjectiveCard score Rankings should be ordered by descending PrivateObjectiveCard score

        public void testSameFavorTokensRankings()
